title: The assassin / Tank meta is so boring for supports.
body:
The assassin / Tank meta has just made support almost impossible.
You can't peel, when your mid / Bot gets 3 shotted out of no where.
You can't protect anyone, if the tank top/jungle or enemy support, are able to walk in and walk out like nothing happened.

I've had a few games now, where I can't shield my adc or apc in time. I can't heal them in time. Because by the time I've hit that button and hovered over, My allies are dead.  

Even if I stay with My adc all the time, I can't be the front line for my team (Because usually I'm the only tank)
And even then, most tanks have a massive gap closer, or an ability that prohibits movements of my allies.
Or the assassin, like Kat-LB-Zed can use two moves, jump in, kill someone and be out like they weren't even there.

They can do that faster then I can hit the exhaust button, or press a button to shield and heal someone.

replies.body:
Support/adc  is like a romance my young friend. The support wins the adc over with gifts of heals and wards and peel... a beautiful friendship is formed... but if the adc is **** garbage the support begins to feel unfulfilled in the relationship. You feel the hurt of many disappointing affairs, but i say, you have been opening your heart up to the wrong crowd my friend. You've been playing with useless noobs that don't even position themselves correctly so you can protect them and set up plays for them. They have taken all that you have found exciting and interesting about life in the bot lane.

I would suggest posting on this forum, title:

'support player, hurt in the past, but ready to love again, looking for a likeminded adc companion'

Support is actually very rewarding when you're working with another competent player to carry and win the game.
Do your work at eHarmony. xD

That's because rock-paper-scissors is more or less a part of the game's balance fundamental. Every competitive game has this somewhere in its core. You're complaining about supposed tanks and assassins diving and deleting squishies, when it's in fact working as intended.

Support and ADC have been the game's biggest balance mistake in the game's history, by intentionally balancing the game in such a way that a ranged carries are almost always needed as well as tagging along the last person who don't have a reliable income with the said ranged carry, and pigeon-hole both of them into bot lane, every single game. And what's more, that's the center of most of all balance decisions, almost every changes are made with ADC-Support bot as the comparison metric. And it's really quite BS really.

The problem is really not assassins deleting squishies that they are meant to do, or tankers diving squishies like they are meant to do, but that supports and ADCs shouldn't be mandatory and viable every game regardless of match-up, composition or strategy.

Its not working as intended, they said that assassins will have some counter play to them.

They do not.

How am I suppose to do my job, when I cannot.

In this season there is nothing a support can do to help there lane.

2 roles completely make supports useless.
Even if they don't go adc bot (I had a ziggs bot who encountered being 2 shotted by everyone else)
Its still an issue.

Why do tanks and assassins get to do their jobs, but as a support I can't do mine.

As the title said, This season is so fucking boring for supports.

----------------

To which we run into another issue, We could not have a support.
Not do it at all.
I could go anyone bot lane, and do just that. 
Heck I could even win against tanks / assassins if I did.
But I would get reported for not being a support, I would get in trouble to break the meta to try and find a way around the currently shit one we have now.
That singed support player almost got perma banned just because he found a way to actually be useful in the meta.

if it wasn't for the risk of being reported, I'd legitimately suggest that 'mundo support' is possibly one of the strongest low elo support picks if you want to carry. You aren't really a support when you play mundo support though. You are essentially a second toplaner since mundo gets all his damage from base, just rush tanky support items and run around killing the enemy. You don't have cc and you can't peel but you have alot of damage and you are very gold efficient and are pretty decent in outpoking most mage supports and engaging on you as a tank support isn't the best idea and once you get a few items you can just pop off and carry.

Best thing about being a part of a duo bot lane, you get to practice these interesting picks for weeks, try taking into ranked and get flamed by your team until someone dodges because they can't see the glorious potential of a Urgot Shen bot lane xD

yeah or the power of jax+kalista botlane, whilst not exactly strong early, the lategame scaling and synergy means you either have to shut it down early, or get shutdown middle-lategame. Oriana adc with wukong support also makes for some interesting gameplay, especially when you both build damage with the 'surprise you're dead now' double ult combo. Also there is a satisfying amount of cheese in the zilean-darius botlane comp.

The Singed player DID get permabanned, and it wasn't for not playing the meta, it was because he was an arsehole and forced his role every game he played.
He was an utter fuckwit, not caring about his team at all, and blatantly disrespected his teams constantly.

That is why he got permabanned, not because he "broke the meta".

Yet you could "break the meta" but it exists for a reason, support is the only consistently viable option for the 5th player, it's the only option that doesn't dilute EXP and Gold harshly, and is available for making up for what a team lacks instead of doubling/tripling down on something it doesn't need extra of.

------------------------------------------------------------

You say Tanks are doing their job?
Strange, because I still see Rammus' with 5000 health and 400+ armour getting killed by Vayne's in less than 2 seconds.

Tanks are not able to do their job when they die so quickly no matter what they build.
And they aren't.

The only "Tanks" that are surviving is the stupid fucking assassins who are building tank like Yasuo.
All the real tanks like Malphite, Rammus, Zac, Sejuani, etc are getting melted in seconds, they die faster than ADCs half the fucking time.

----------------------------------------------------------

Assassins on the other hand are in a fairly decent spot right now except for a few. (like say Yasuo who after buying {{item:3046}} {{item:3031}} can build tank and dominate with no opposition)

LeBlanc needs some tweaking, her kite is too far off scale with how quickly she can chain her chains in succession.

Zed is quite manageable especially if you take {{summoner:3}} .

Rengar is fantastic! He has excellent trade offs of engage with risk and damage output.

Honestly if you don't have time to shield or whatever that's more on your lack of reflexes than the game's problem.
Yasuo isn't an assassin.

Only rengar and talon were given a real burst time reduction (Akali too, but that goes with her next buff in 7.2, which practically returns all her scalings to her original state instead of 1/2),  zed, kha, fizz and all that still instagib you though. 
Shaco was nerfed recently to remove his ability to burst anything but he can clean up fights very well. Talon literally can't get his damage out unless you walk into a bush he is standing in then end up in melee range, his delays are too long to serve him well in fights, mainly because the delay on his w negates all his ulti effects if the second strike hits when in his ult.

Support is really just anyone who function and perform outside of the gold resource system, that's really it. Anyone with utility built into their kit can support, and the more utility-centric a champ is, the more effective they are in doing that. Theoretically, they can be put anywhere as desired by the strategy.

The issue is that Riot and the community forces Supports into bot-lane to team up with the ADCs while trying to make it work regardless of any and all factors and for every single match.

Support can not do what they are supposed to do in this forced-teaming with ADCs, because they will outshine the ADCs in their performance (as they are generally the ones making saves and staging the kills), which Riot and some players don't want. And it becomes even more problematic in that ADCs are not even supposed to be strong early so of course Supports can and should surpass ADCs especially in early game, but again, Riot and some players don't want to see that.

So they thought about methods of making their vision work:

1. They first tried making ADCs outright broken across all stages of the match, so that Supports get to do what they need to do like everybody else and they won't be outshining the ADCs as well. Which of course, didn't turn out so well.
2. So they changed the approach, and this time, they make Supports outright useless. So they can't do what they're supposed to do properly, but hey, they aren't outshining the ADCs anymore. And Riot at the moment, seems to think this is fine.

This is why I focused my argument mostly around the ADC-support thingy and how it is the thing that we need to get rid off rather than blaming the tanks and assassins for doing their jobs properly, as well as trying to fix issues within the boundaries of the problem itself rather than trying to improve or remove the said problem.

even though they can be played support, if you play these champions, or annie, annivia, fizz or lux as a support. In my books, you aren't really a 'support main' or embody the spirit of supporting so much as a 'mage sent botlane'.
